column2: Q1. What year are you in?
column3: Q2. How many close friends do you regularly spend time with on campus?
column4: Q3a. How often do you want to hang out with someone but don’t end up doing it?
column5: Q3b. What usually stops you? (Select all that apply)
column6: Q4. Have you ever wanted to study, walk, or chill with someone but couldn’t find anyone in the same mood?
column7: Q5. How often do you feel lonely or socially disconnected on campus?
column8: Q6. When being matched with someone for a spontaneous hangout, what matters MOST to you? (Select all that apply)
column9: Q7. Which of these activities would you most want to be matched for? (Select up to 3)
column10: Q8. How do you feel about matches expiring after the session (no long-term chat history)?
column11: Q9. Would you be comfortable meeting someone matched by AI around campus?
column12: Q10. How would you feel about AI helping start and guide the group chat conversation (e.g., suggesting icebreakers, topics based on shared interests)?
column13: Q11. Would you trust AI to match you with the right people better than you could find on your own?
column14: Q12. When would you most likely use an app like this? (Select all that apply)
column15: Q13. What is your biggest concern about using an app like this?
column16: Q6. Based on the description above, how likely would you be to try Wavelength?
column17: Q14. Anything else you’d want from an app like this, or any concerns we didn’t ask about?

column17: I feel like it’d be used as a dating app, which isn’t a bad thing. Some sort of verification would be good to make sure everyone feels safe. Not a general hang out app unless it’s a dating app.

column17: AI (LLM generative or otherwise) use in the matching algorithm would be effective, but AI use in chats and for generative texting would likely diminish the effectiveness of your app. People would be unable to get the "vibe" of the other person through their messages which may lead to undesirable results upon meeting in person. I strongly discourage the use of AI for any front-end user elements.
